summary: The Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank failures in 2023 raised questions about federal bank supervision. This Q&A report shows that the Federal Reserve and the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation identified numerous concerns at the banks as early as 2018, but did not issue enforcement actions, which would have required the banks to fix the problems. title: Bank Supervision: More Timely Escalation of Supervisory Action Needed
